dao.xlink:title: E. G. Colton [Emma Goldman] (Paris?, France) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman writes about a gathering she has convened to which she invites [William C.] Owen and Keell. She also comments on the books she ordered.

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (Paris, France) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman wonders if Keell received her last letter. She announces that she is coming to London for a week, and wishes to meet the new team for Freedom.

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (London, England) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman orders a copy of Laura Riding's "Anarchism is not Enough." She comments that younger blood is needed to support Freedom via a circulating letter. She then requests payment for any copies of "My Disillusionment" Keell has on hand.

did.unittitle: Emma Goldman (Paris, France) to Tom [Keell] (London, England)

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (Paris, France) to Tom [Keell] (London, England)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In a postcard, Goldman thanks Keell for the books received and then provides her new address. She asks whether the circulating letter has been sent yet.

did.unittitle: Emma Goldman (St. Tropez, France) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (St. Tropez, France) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman requests data for her autobiography.

did.unittitle: Emma Goldman (St. Tropez, France) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (St. Tropez, France) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman writes about the divisions in the anarchist movement that keep it from growing. She hopes Keell's plan for monthly indoor lectures succeeds. She requests more information for her book and discusses its progress. She then requests he send her another book.

did.unittitle: Emma Goldman (St. Tropez, France) to Joseph (n.p.)

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (St. Tropez, France) to Joseph (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman discusses the difficulties she faces in writing her book, and requests and extension on a book chapter she promised to write. She adds a brief history of birth control in the United States.

did.unittitle: Emma Goldman (St. Tropez, France) to Harry [Kelly?] (n.p.)

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (St. Tropez, France) to Harry [Kelly?] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman writes about the difficulty she has had in getting information for her book regarding specific individuals. She then requests a copy of a book, and notes that Berkman has finished writing his most recent book.

dao.xlink:title: [Emma Goldman] (Paris, France) to Mr. Holmes (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman writes that she and Holmes will never see eye to eye on Russia, because he will accept no proofs for criticism of the regime, and he does not separate the State from Society.

did.unittitle: Emma Goldman (St. Tropez, France) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (St. Tropez, France) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman notes progress made on her book, and comments on the closing of Freedom's London office, despite the increasing interest in the newspaper: " I wish I knew whether it is due to our methods of propaganda, or to the general reaction in the world, that there is so little interest in Anarchism." She then outlines her travel plans.

did.unittitle: Emma Goldman (St. Tropez, France) to William C. Owen (Storrington, England)

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (St. Tropez, France) to William C. Owen (Storrington, England)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman writes about Owen's health concerns and asks if he would permit her to raise a private subscription for him.

did.unittitle: Emma Goldman (St. Tropez, France) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (St. Tropez, France) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In a postcard, Goldman thanks Keell for sending articles written by William C. Owen, and then recommends others he can approach for information regarding Owen, who has died.

did.unittitle: Emma Goldman (Paris, France) to Tom H. Keell (Near Stroud., England)

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (Paris, France) to Tom H. Keell (Near Stroud., England)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman writes that she is completely focused on her book, to the exclusion of other matters, including writing an article regarding William C. Owen. She suggests he approach someone else. She then discusses when her manuscript is due and the advance she would like to use to settle her debts with Keell.

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (Paris, France) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman announces that all their plans have been disrupted. Berkman has been deported to Belgium and she has been working for his right to reenter. The rest of the letter concerns an attack made on Keell in Freedom. Goldman thinks personal grievances have no place in the paper, but plans to protest the attack anyway. "I really feel most unhappy over our trouble and the general condition in our ranks, the vindictive]ness, the wrangles, they are sickening."

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (Paris, France) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman writes to arrange a meeting with Keell, [Max?] Nettlau, and [Alexander?] Shapiro. They will possibly discuss a joint protest to Freedom regarding the attack on Keell.

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (Paris, France) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman writes that the protest to Freedom is complete, and is on its way to Rudolf Rocker in London for his signature and forwarding to the paper. She adds that Berkman has returned. She plans to leave for Germany.

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (Berlin, Germany) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman recommends that Keell wait for the August issue to appear before enquiring about their protest. She also advises him to also grive the "new group" access to the Freedom plant, to help end the personal squabbles.

did.unittitle: Emma Goldman (St. Tropez, France) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (St. Tropez, France) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman again counsels Keell to wait for the protest to appear, and to settle the matter privately.

did.unittitle: Emma Goldman (St. Tropez, France) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (St. Tropez, France) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman congratulates Keell on his restrained tone in response to the attack on him. She outlines her work to complete her autobiography, although she must wait a year for it to be published. She hopes to do more for Freedom Press in the coming year.

did.unittitle: Emma Goldman (St. Tropez, France) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (St. Tropez, France) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman requests a pamphlet and point of information she requires to complete her book.

dao.xlink:title: [Emma Goldman] (St. Tropez, France) to "old Scout" (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman reports that she has finished her book, and requests that it be given a serious reading. She also reports that Berkman has been granted a stay, with renewals. She adds that she will soon travel to Nice.

dao.xlink:title: [Emma Goldman] (Nice, France) to Joseph [Ishill] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman notes that Alexander Berkman has been permitted to stay in the country and that she has completed her book, although she is suffering with extreme pain in her heels. She recommends sources of information on Voltairine de Cleyre. She comments on the respect that Knopf has shown her autobiography. Finally, she writes that she would like to meet Elie Faure.

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (Nice, France) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman announces that she has finished her book, but discusses her physical issues. She requests that Keell send a copy of her essays to a Polish group publishing an encyclopedia of Yiddish writers. She then comments on George Davison's death.

dao.xlink:title: [Emma Goldman] (Nice, France) to Evelyn [Metcalfe?] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman reports on finishing her book, and that doing so has deeply fatigued her. She adds that she is in Nice only temporarily, because of the expense. She then comments on Clifford McCarthy, a recent acquaintance.

did.unittitle: [Emma Goldman] (St. Tropez, France) to "Good Comrade" (n.p.) [Max Nettlau?]

dao.xlink:title: [Emma Goldman] (St. Tropez, France) to "Good Comrade" (n.p.) [Max Nettlau?]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman despairs "the difficulty of getting to any understanding by means of letters." Topics include the treatment of Rysanov by Soviet authorities, anarchism as a progressive cause, the lack of stress on preparing individuals and the masses for what comes after the Revolution, her sense that she is useless and unable to be in touch with the masses, the revolution in Spain compared to the Russian revolution, and her inability to attend the Syndicalist Congress in Spain.

did.unittitle: [Emma Goldman] (St. Tropez, France) to "Friends" [Mark and Johanna]

dao.xlink:title: [Emma Goldman] (St. Tropez, France) to "Friends" [Mark and Johanna]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman writes of feeling fatigued following the completion of her book, and discusses first paper to do a story on her autobiography and its Yiddish translation, and the final release of the 2-volume set. She comments on the Spanish Republic and reports on Alexander Berkman's activities.

did.unittitle: Emma Goldman (St. Tropez, France) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (St. Tropez, France) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman writes to ask Keell what books he has loaned her should be returned. She comments on the failure of Knopf's London office, and on George Davison's estate, and her plans to read Max Nettlau's latest book. In a postscript she comments on the Freedom Bulletin, wondering if it still exists.

did.unittitle: Emma Goldman (St. Tropez, France) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (St. Tropez, France) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman writes of her travel plans, Alexander Berkman's medical condition, the release of her autobiography, and the puzzle that is her future plans.

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (Paris, France) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman outlines the possibility of a European speaking tour, then comments on her autobiography -- the British edition, favorable reviews, the high cost of the volumes, and review copies.

did.unittitle: Emma Goldman (St. Tropez, France) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (St. Tropez, France) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman writes about the British edition of her autobiography, and her possible plans to come to London

did.unittitle: Emma Goldman (The Hague, Netherlands) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (The Hague, Netherlands) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman informs Keell of her travel plans for England. She then comments on one of her attackers in the movement and informs Keell of the death of comrade Maria Goldsmith. In a postscript she notes the high price of the British edition of her autobiography, and comments on Rebecca West, an English contact.

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (London, England) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman comments on several meetings held in London, and outlines more meetings in the future. She then comments on the Anti War Congress held by the Communists.

did.unittitle: Emma Goldman (St. Tropez, France) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (St. Tropez, France) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman outlines her travel plans, with a possible return to England rather than to Canada. She requests his suggestions for reaching the non-Communist members of the Labour movement. She then comments on her failure to make money in other endeavors.

did.unittitle: Emma Goldman (S.S. Ascania Cunard Line) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (S.S. Ascania Cunard Line) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman reports that she was kicked out of Holland following her third lecture, and since nothing was planning in England, she is now on her way to Canada. She reports that she has low expectations for the trip, but there is a possibility of a visa for the United States. She requests that Keell send literature for her to sell at her lectures.

did.unittitle: Emma Goldman (Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania) to Evelyn Metcalfe (Saratoga Springs, New York)

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania) to Evelyn Metcalfe (Saratoga Springs, New York)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman discusses her plans to visit Metcalfe, and the failure of her tour in the United States.

did.unittitle: Emma Goldman (Rochester, New York) to Thomas Lavers (Bristol, England)

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (Rochester, New York) to Thomas Lavers (Bristol, England)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman discusses her United States tour and its possible extension, the effect the tour has had upon her, and its mismanagement. She mentions meeting a anarchist from Chicago, Frank Heiner.

dao.xlink:title: [Emma Goldman] (Montreal, Canada) to "Comrade" (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman reports on her tour, the raising of money for Russian political prisoners, and successful publicity and contacts made. She hopes for an extended visa for another trip to the United States.

did.unittitle: Emma Goldman (Toronto?, Canada) to Thomas H. Keell (Stroud, England)

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (Toronto?, Canada) to Thomas H. Keell (Stroud, England)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman discusses the successes and failures of her tour, then requests that Keell go about purchasing the sheets for Berkman's prison memoir.

did.unittitle: Emma Goldman (Toronto, Canada) to Thomas [H.] Keell (Stroud, England)

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (Toronto, Canada) to Thomas [H.] Keell (Stroud, England)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman discusses obtaining discounted copies of Berkman's prison memoirs or purchasing the plates for the work. She then outlines her unsettled plans for touring in Europe, America, or Canada, and the lack of advancement in anarchist ideas. She closes by discussing the death of Erich Muhsam.

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (Toronto, Canada) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman requests literature to be sent for sale at her lectures, along with a settling of accounts. She closes by discussing the death of [John?] Turner.

did.unittitle: Emma Goldman (Toronto, Canada) to Thomas H. Keell (Stroud, England)

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (Toronto, Canada) to Thomas H. Keell (Stroud, England)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman discusses her failure to raise any money, and her hesitancy to purchase the copies of Berkman's memoirs. In addition, she laments the lack of good organizers and writers in the United States. She lists the articles she will soon publish.

did.unittitle: [Emma Goldman] (Toronto, Canada) to B. Yelensky (Chicago, Illinois)

dao.xlink:title: [Emma Goldman] (Toronto, Canada) to B. Yelensky (Chicago, Illinois)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman writes that she has been forced to drop the project of republishing Berkman's book in the United States, and that she will stay in Canada until the Spring, trying to earn some money. She then outlines how money should be collected in support of the Spanish Revolution and the role of the intelligentsia in the anarchist movement.

did.unittitle: Emma Goldman (Montreal, Canada) to Thomas H. Keell (Stroud, England)

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (Montreal, Canada) to Thomas H. Keell (Stroud, England)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman writes that her tour has not been as successful as the last time she was in Montreal. One reason has been the reactionary stance of the local government, another the glamor of Bolshevik ideas. She writes of her plans for the tour, and a return to America or France in the Spring.

did.unittitle: Emma Goldman (Montreal, Canada) to Joseph Ishill (Berkeley Heights, New Jersey)

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (Montreal, Canada) to Joseph Ishill (Berkeley Heights, New Jersey)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman writes about her lack of help with her tour, her work with anarchist youth, and the backwardness in ideas in Canada. She comments on Ishill's work on William Morris and Votairine de Clayre. She hopes to visit Ishill during an American tour.

did.unittitle: [Emma Goldman, Montreal, Canada] to Jeanne Levey (Chicago, Illinois)

dao.xlink:title: [Emma Goldman, Montreal, Canada] to Jeanne Levey (Chicago, Illinois)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman discusses her apartment, her plans for a 10-lecture tour, the assistance she is receiving, and how she must fight Communist and Fascist ideas. In a postscript she discusses her articles in Harpers.

did.unittitle: Emma Goldman (Montreal, Canada) to Tom Keell (Stroud, England)

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (Montreal, Canada) to Tom Keell (Stroud, England)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman notes that she has returned pamphlets rather than have them confiscated. She comments on London Freedom, and the death of a mutual comrade, "Charles."

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (n.p.) to Comrade

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman compares Marinus van der Lubbe's association with the Reichstag fire and Alexander Berkman's Frick assassination attempt. She then discusses Anarcho-Syndicalist theory. She comments on growing anti-war feeling among the youth. Page 2 of the letter is missing.

did.unittitle: Emma Goldman (S.S. Ascania Cunard Line) to Thomas H. Keell (Stroud, England)

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (S.S. Ascania Cunard Line) to Thomas H. Keell (Stroud, England)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman briefly outlines her plans once she returns to France.

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (Paris, France) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman comments about the postponement of her lectures in England, along with plans for copies to be produced of the Berkman memoir.

did.unittitle: Emma Goldman (London, England) to Thomas H. Keell (Stroud, England)

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (London, England) to Thomas H. Keell (Stroud, England)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In a postcard, Goldman requests some bound copies of Berkman's memoirs to place on sale at her lectures.

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (London, England) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman objects to the "commercial tone" of Keell's recent letter, noting that she will settle the account for the copies of Berkman's memoirs.

did.unittitle: Emma Goldman (London, England) to Thomas H. Keell (Stroud, England)

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (London, England) to Thomas H. Keell (Stroud, England)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman comments on the difficulty of finding a publisher for a German work Berkman has been translating.

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (London?, England) to Harry [Kelly?] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman writes that Berkman has celebrated his sixty-fifth birthday. She requests that Harry send the money owed Berkman, commenting on their poverty and difficulty in raising money. She is more positive that this lecture tour will yield positive results, and especially excited to speak with the youth at the National Labor Colleges in South Wales. She desires most of all to gain ground for the anarchist movement in England.

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (London, England) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman comments on possible work for Berkman, her general busyness, the literature for her lectures, and completed payment for the Berkman memoirs.

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (London?, England) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman writes that her current lecture tour has failed, but she has plans for more lectures in the Fall. She requests more literature, then comments on the cost of shipping the Berkman memoir to the United States and Canada.

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (London, England) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman comments on the progress of her work in Plymouth and her upcoming lectures, for which she requests some literature. She then reports that Berkman has been hospitalized and therefore she wants to make a profit, if possible, on the sale of his memoir.

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (n.p.) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman writes about her schedule for lectures, then comments on a contact for the Labor Colleges in London. She describes how she almost succumbed to carbon monoxide poisoning.

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (London, England) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman requests literature written by her for her lectures.

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (London, England) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman writes of the success of her recent lectures. She adds that Alexander Berkman has undergone a second surgery and is recovering. She will return to France as soon as possible, but adds that with the possibility of war it is "downright stupid to make plans."

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (n.p.) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman settles her accounts, and asks if Alexander Berkman is due any more money for his memoirs. She plans to leave for France immediately and asks Keell about their contact for the Labor Colleges in London.

did.unittitle: Emma Goldman (Nice, France) to Thomas H. Keell (Stroud, England)

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (Nice, France) to Thomas H. Keell (Stroud, England)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In a postcard, Goldman reports on Alexander Berkman's condition.

did.unittitle: Emma Goldman (Nice, France) to Thomas H. Keell (Stroud, England)

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (Nice, France) to Thomas H. Keell (Stroud, England)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In a postcard, Goldman provides an update on Alexander Berkman's improved condition.

did.unittitle: Emma Goldman (Nice, France) to Thomas H. Keell (Stroud, England)

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (Nice, France) to Thomas H. Keell (Stroud, England)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In a postcard, Goldman discusses money due for Alexander Berkman's memoir, then provides an update on Berkman's condition.

did.unittitle: Emma Goldman (Nice, France) to E. C. Carbo

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (Nice, France) to E. C. Carbo

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman answers a questionnaire regarding Anarchist principles, sent for Alexander Berkman. She writes about Anarchist participation in elections, power during the revolutionary transition period, solidarity with the workers, and various situations in Spain.

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (Nice, France) to Tom [Keell] (n.p)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman provides an update on Alexander Berkman's condition, and the condition of Emmy, Berkman's girlfriend. She comments on her recent letter to the comrades in Spain and the disappearance of Erich Muhsam's widow, then outlines the current plans for her next speaking tour in England.

did.unittitle: Emma Goldman (Nice, France) to Thomas H. Keell (Stroud, England)

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (Nice, France) to Thomas H. Keell (Stroud, England)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In a postcard, Goldman announces Alexander Berkman's death, and her plans to return to St. Tropez.

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (London, England) to Harry [Kelly?] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman writes that her work with Spain is finished, but she worries about events there, because she can get no direct word from participants.She argues that she may have to drop her membership in the CNT-FAI. She comments on a possible visa for the United States, then on Errico Malatesta's activities in Spain.

did.unittitle: Emma Goldman (Marseille, France) to T. H. Keell (Stroud, England)

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (Marseille, France) to T. H. Keell (Stroud, England)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman writes that she is en route to Barcelona and "it means going into the cage of mad days."

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (London, England) to "Dear friend"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In an open letter, Goldman announces an opening of an English office for the International Anti-Fascist Solidarity (S.I.A.), and its plans to support refugees in Catalonia.

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (London, England) to Harry [Kelly?] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman writes about her ill-fated attempts to raise money for her comrades in Spain, and the general indifference to the plight of people there. She contrasts this with the emotional letters she receives from Spain, which inspire her to keep working. She reports on plans to develop a committee to work on obtaining a visa for her to visit the United States, although she plans to go to Canada.

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (Toronto, Canada) to C.V. (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman charges her rejuvenated spirit to her work in Spain. She discusses the reproduction of clippings and writing a message for the comrades in the West.

did.unittitle: Emma Goldman (Toronto, Canada) to Harry Kelly (New Rochelle, New York)

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (Toronto, Canada) to Harry Kelly (New Rochelle, New York)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In a postcard, Goldman mentions a wire she sent that has gone awry, and being remembered by her friends. She also requests the loan of books.

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (Toronto, Canada) to Harry [Kelly?] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman notes the potential for some lectures in Winnipeg. She comments on the help of a good friend, Harry's unemployment, and that they have been compelled to act on their ideas, whether successful or not. She also comments on the "Stalin criminals" and their activities in Spain and France.

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (Toronto, Canada) to Harry [Kelly?] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goldman outlines the various ways she has been celebrating her 70th birthday, and of her plans to celebrate the 50th anniversary of pledging herself to anarchism.

dao.xlink:title: [Emma Goldman] to unknown

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Page 2 of unidentified letter. Goldman discusses efforts to support the transportation of Spanish comrades to Mexico, and comments on working with Communists and on [Juan?] Negrin.

did.unittitle: Emma Goldman (n.p.) to J. B. Moore (Philadelphia, Pennsylvania)

dao.xlink:title: Emma Goldman (n.p.) to J. B. Moore (Philadelphia, Pennsylvania)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In a copy of a telegram, Goldman writes that a Jewish meeting may not be announced before an English meeting.

did.unittitle: Maurice A. Hanline (n.p.) to Emma Goldman

dao.xlink:title: Maurice A. Hanline (n.p.) to Emma Goldman

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Hanline, who was vice president at publishing firm Horace LIveright, praises Goldman's autobiography, stating that he has instructed that an advance be offered for the work.

did.unittitle: Thomas H. Keell (London, England) to Emma Goldman (n.p.)

dao.xlink:title: Thomas H. Keell (London, England) to Emma Goldman (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Keell provides a statement of accounts and payments made, and notes an outstanding balance.

dao.xlink:title: C. Edwards (London?, England) to "Dear Comrade"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Edwards sent this letter on behalf of the Emma Goldman Lecture Committee, to solicit funds in support of public meetings to be held by Emma Goldman in London.

did.unittitle: Harry Kelly (New Rochelle, New York) to Emma Goldman (n.p.)

dao.xlink:title: Harry Kelly (New Rochelle, New York) to Emma Goldman (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Kelly mentions that he received and read aloud her wire. He outlines possible books for Goldman to read.

dao.xlink:title: Ma[nnie?] (?, Conn.?) to Harry [Kelly] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ma[nnie] discusses dinners to be held in honor of Emma Goldman's 50th anniversary as an anarchist. He prefers the dinners be held with her present. He would prefer to work for a dinner for Leonard [?].

did.unittitle: H. Lynch (Toronto, Canada) to Emma Goldman (Toronto, Canada)

dao.xlink:title: H. Lynch (Toronto, Canada) to Emma Goldman (Toronto, Canada)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Lynch writes regarding arrangements for a debate between Goldman and Mr. Silver, a representative of the Socialist Labor Party.

did.unittitle: A. [Alexander M.] Shapiro (Stockholm, Sweden) to [Thomas H.] Keell (n.p.)

dao.xlink:title: A. [Alexander M.] Shapiro (Stockholm, Sweden) to [Thomas H.] Keell (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Shapiro writes that his address in Moscow is blockaded, regarding misinformation about Russia in the press, including the fate of Russian political prisoners, especially those on hunger strikes. He plans to return to Russia if permitted to do so. In the meantime he wishes to catch up on the anarchist international movement and orders copies of Freedom from Keell.

did.unittitle: A. [Alexander M.] Shapiro (Stockholm, Sweden) to [Thomas H.] Keell (n.p.)

dao.xlink:title: A. [Alexander M.] Shapiro (Stockholm, Sweden) to [Thomas H.] Keell (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Shapiro writes about ten anarchists shot in Russia and the various press coverage he will send to Keell. He also writes how he came to be in Sweden.

did.unittitle: Sophie Kropotkin (Paris, France) to Miss Addams (n.p.)

dao.xlink:title: Sophie Kropotkin (Paris, France) to Miss Addams (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Kropotkin asks Addams to form a Peter Kropotkin Memorial Committee in the United States.

did.unittitle: Antoinette F. Konikow (Boston, Massachusetts) to Comrade Swabeck (n.p.)

dao.xlink:title: Antoinette F. Konikow (Boston, Massachusetts) to Comrade Swabeck (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Konikow writes to invite a speaker to Boston and comments on an "infernal plot" having to do with resolutions being considered.

did.unittitle: John G. Wright (n.p.) to Comrade Swabeck (n.p.)

dao.xlink:title: John G. Wright (n.p.) to Comrade Swabeck (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wright urges immediate action in response to Stalinist transgressions.

did.unittitle: Antoinette F. Konikow (Boston, Massachusetts) to Comrade Swabeck (n.p.)

dao.xlink:title: Antoinette F. Konikow (Boston, Massachusetts) to Comrade Swabeck (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Konikow makes a contribution to a monetary fund, and urges a meeting to protest "the infamous frame-up of Stalin," with coverage in the press, especially The Nation.

did.unittitle: Antoinette F. Konikow (Boston, Massachusetts) to Comrade Swabeck (n.p.)

dao.xlink:title: Antoinette F. Konikow (Boston, Massachusetts) to Comrade Swabeck (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Konikow makes a contribution to a fund, and seeks to arrange a meeting with Comrade Shachtman regarding the frame-up of Stalin.

did.unittitle: No name (n.p.) to Antoinette F. Konikow (Boston, Massachusetts)

dao.xlink:title: No name (n.p.) to Antoinette F. Konikow (Boston, Massachusetts)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Unidentified writer, perhaps Comrade Swabeck?, writes about the frame-up of Stalin, the planned statements regarding events, planning for the meeting with Shachtman, and publication of articles.

did.unittitle: Antoinette F. Konikow (Boston, Massachusetts) to Comrade Swabeck (n.p.)

dao.xlink:title: Antoinette F. Konikow (Boston, Massachusetts) to Comrade Swabeck (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Konikow writes regarding a speaker for a Spanish meeting, adding that the Communist Party is organizing its own large meeting beforehand.

dao.xlink:title: No name (n.p.) to Comrade Konikow (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Unidentified writer, perhaps Comrade Swabeck?, writes about possible speakers for Konikow's meeting on Spain.

did.unittitle: Antoinette F. Konikow (Boston, Massachusetts) to Comrade Swabeck (n.p.)

dao.xlink:title: Antoinette F. Konikow (Boston, Massachusetts) to Comrade Swabeck (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Konikow writes of the speakers she will contact for her meeting, then questions their endorsement of a publication.

dao.xlink:title: Willy Winnick (n.p.) to Anne (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Winnick describes in detail local meetings planned and held, and the dispute over the federated labor party resolution.

did.unittitle: Antoinette F. Konikow (n.p.) to Comrade Swabeck (n.p.)

dao.xlink:title: Antoinette F. Konikow (n.p.) to Comrade Swabeck (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Konikow writes requesting clarification regarding a resolution on a federated labor party passed by a local Labor Party Caucus.

dao.xlink:title: Willy Winnick (n.p.) to Anne (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Winnick writes in detail about the disagreement regarding the resolution on a federated labor party, and requests a response.

dao.xlink:title: No name (n.p.) to [Willy] Winnick (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The unidentified author discusses the struggle against the centrist Zamites and suggests there should be flexibility regarding the federated labor party question.

did.unittitle: Irving S. Abrams, Emma Goldman Memorial Committee (Chicago, Illinois) to Comrade

dao.xlink:title: Irving S. Abrams, Emma Goldman Memorial Committee (Chicago, Illinois) to Comrade

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Abrams writes to solicit funds for Goldman's funeral expenses, cemetery lot, monument, and caretaking for the grave.

did.unittitle: M. E. Fitzgerald, Mother Earth Publishing Association (New York, New York) to Freedom Press (London, England)

dao.xlink:title: M. E. Fitzgerald, Mother Earth Publishing Association (New York, New York) to Freedom Press (London, England)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Fitzgerald writes regarding subscription fulfillment and ordering issues.She mentions the hunger strike of Rebecca Edelsohn, who protested against the United States becoming involved in a war with Mexico.

did.unittitle: Mother Earth Publishing Association (New York, New York) to Freedom Press (London, England)

dao.xlink:title: Mother Earth Publishing Association (New York, New York) to Freedom Press (London, England)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: An unidentified employee orders some books, then comments on the problem of selling books: "Because all the stupid men of Europe are busy killing each other that is no reason why the intelligent men shouldn't be reading." There is an update regarding Alexander Berkman's activities and a comment on Kropotkin's stance on the war.

did.unittitle: Bert G. Plattin to the editor of The Communist (n.p.)

dao.xlink:title: Bert G. Plattin to the editor of The Communist (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Plattin questions why the paper has been silent regarding the "vendetta of the ruling class in Russia against our comrades the Anarchists & Syndicalists."

did.unittitle: R. W. Postgate, The Communist (London, England) to Messrs. Platten Randolph, Robert & Konna, The Cooperative Land & Crafts Guild (Holt, England)

dao.xlink:title: R. W. Postgate, The Communist (London, England) to Messrs. Platten Randolph, Robert & Konna, The Cooperative Land & Crafts Guild (Holt, England)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Postgate writes that he imagines the letters refer to the expulsion of Emma Goldman and Alexander Berkman from Russia. He argues that the two were supported by the Russian government, and in return only attacked the government as "bitterly as they could." The government asked them to move on. He adds "I think you should remember that the present Government in Russia is a dictatorship of the proletariat."

did.unittitle: Edward Shortt (n.p.) to Colonel J. C. Wedgwood, M. P. (n.p.)

dao.xlink:title: Edward Shortt (n.p.) to Colonel J. C. Wedgwood, M. P. (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Home Secretary Shortt writes that Max Eastman has sailed from New York and should be refused entry to the country.

did.unittitle: Li-Pei-Kan (Shanghai, China) to Dear Comrade [Emma Goldman] (n.p.)

dao.xlink:title: Li-Pei-Kan (Shanghai, China) to Dear Comrade [Emma Goldman] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Kan writes of conditions in China, the labor movements and activities of the imperialists and the Communist Party, along with his own work at writing anarchist articles and translations.

did.unittitle: Li-Pei-Kan (Shanghai, China) to Dear Comrade [Emma Goldman] (n.p.)

dao.xlink:title: Li-Pei-Kan (Shanghai, China) to Dear Comrade [Emma Goldman] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Kan discusses the civil war in China and the activities of Communists. He requests literature from Freedom Press.

dao.xlink:title: [Illegible] Newman (London, England) to Tom Keell (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Newman discusses discovering what happened at a meeting [s]he missed, and borrowed books.

dao.xlink:title: Unidentified to Albert E. Arent

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The unidentified writer writes regarding arrangements for Emma Goldman to speak at Cornell.

did.unittitle: Edward H. Zabuskie to Emma Goldman

dao.xlink:title: Edward H. Zabuskie to Emma Goldman

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Zabuskie writes to invite Emma Goldman to speak at Dana College, if her schedule permits.

did.unittitle: Helen Hau[nam] Joseph to Emma Goldman

dao.xlink:title: Helen Hau[nam] Joseph to Emma Goldman

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Joseph offers any help she can provide for Goldman's visit to Cleveland, then invites Goldman to dine with her at her home.

dao.xlink:title: [Kochaks?] (Bordighera, Italy) to Tom [Keell] (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: [Kochaks] thanks Keell for his comments on a book he has written, then describes his return to living in a village in Italy.

did.unittitle: Unidentified (n.p.) to Emma Goldman (New York, New York)

dao.xlink:title: Unidentified (n.p.) to Emma Goldman (New York, New York)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The writer purchases a subscription for Goldman's book.

did.unittitle: "One who does not approve" to whom it may concern

dao.xlink:title: One who does not approve to whom it may concern

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: On the back of a flyer for the event, the writer disapproves of Emma Goldman's speaking about her autobiography in Philadelphia, and expresses surprise at the list of "respected" citizens noted as sponsors.

dao.xlink:title: R.A.P [Preston] to Mr. [Alfred A.] Knopf

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Preston provides a favorable internal reader's report for Goldman's autobiography.

did.unittitle: Unidentified (n.p.) to editor of L'Adunata dei refrattari (n.p.)

dao.xlink:title: Unidentified (n.p.) to editor of L'Adunata dei refrattari (n.p.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Handwritten letter to the editor or article for this New York City newspaper, regarding stipulations the State Department has placed on Emma Goldman's reentry into the country.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Papers Series includes materials related to various prominent anarchists in addition to Emma Goldman. There are typescript drafts of four articles and letters by anarchists; nine handwritten articles on anarchist themes written in Italian by Errico Malatesta; publications; press releases for Emma Goldman; ephemera, including tickets, brochures, solicitation letters, handbills and flyers; a contract and room layout for speaking engagements by Goldman; Thomas H. Keell's list of works on anarchism; newspaper clippings related to Goldman; and six black-and-white photographs, including one portrait and two group photographs featuring Goldman, one of Alexander Berkman and his girlfriend, one of Harry Kelly, as well as an unidentified subject.

dao.xlink:title: Typescript articles and letters

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes four typescript articles and letters, often with annotations or corrections, signed by the authors, including Alexander Berkman, Emma Goldman, and [Alexander?] Shapiro. Topics include persecution and prisons in Russia and discussion of anarchist theory.

dao.xlink:title: Errico Malatesta handwritten articles

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes six articles by Malatesta, written on various anarchist topics.

dao.xlink:title: Errico Malatesta handwritten articles

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes three articles by Malatesta, written in Italian on various anarchist topics.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes two publications: one related to Alexander Berkman's 60th birthday celebration held at the Central Opera House in New York City (1930); the other to the Modern School of Stelton Twenty-fifth Anniversary (1940).

dao.xlink:title: Press releases

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes eighteen press releases for Emma Goldman. Some are master copies; the majority probably date to the 1930s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes invitations, tickets, flyers, and handbills, mostly related to speaking engagements or dinners for Emma Goldman. There is also a subscription list form for a book by Alexander Berkman. One flyer is written in Hebrew or Yiddish.

dao.xlink:title: Speaking engagement documents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Inlcudes a 1934 speaking engagement contract for Emmma Goldman, as well as an undated seating chart for a venue.

did.unittitle: Keell's typescript list of works on anarchism

dao.xlink:title: Keell's typescript list of works on anarchism

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a one-page, annotated list of anarchist works probably maintained by Thomas Keell.

dao.xlink:title: Newspaper clippings (originals)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes 29 articles and letters to the editor, almost entirely from papers in London.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes photocopies of the original 29 articles and letters to the editor, almost entirely from papers in London.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes six gelatin silver and albumen photographs. There is one portrait of Emma Goldman and two group photographs that feature her, a photograph of Harry Kelly, and a photograph of Alexander Berkman and his girlfriend Emmy Eckstein. The final photograph is of an unidentified man.
